column4: Can somebody tell me which programs I can remove safely from Ubuntu's Synaptic or by using: apt-get remove   ???
Well I have to my knowledge removed all the programs that I don't need
What I need is some information about system programs which can be removed safely linke LVM, etc ?
Well you can get rid of postfix, assuming you don't run a mail server.
You can also remove cups, assuming you don't have any printing needs.
What I'd usualy do to cut down on HDD space is get rid of my DE since that usually is a big chunk of disk.
If you're tight on space I'd go with fluxbox since it's one of the smallest WM's I've seen so far.
vim is the only vi like editor installed, as far as I know.
If you wanna keep any settings just  back em up before you delete anything.
Maybe dev tools if you have no use for them.
Dunno, I don't know any installed by default. Check if you have gcc installed.
Like I said if you have no use for them ...
Check if you have any foreign tongue dictionaries.
